skill.description: Standardize formatting and apply consistent style to the deliverable. Use after generation to ensure the output matches the user's formatting standards and conventions.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. All static findings are false positives from metadata fields and code examples. No executable code, network operations, or file system access exists. The skill provides formatting guidance to AI assistants.

content.user_title: Apply consistent formatting to AI-generated deliverables
content.value_statement: AI-generated code and documentation often has inconsistent formatting that looks unprofessional. This skill enforces uniform style rules, naming conventions, and formatting standards to make any deliverable production-ready.
actual_capabilities: Apply consistent code formatting including indentation, spacing, and naming conventions
Standardize documentation formatting for headers, lists, and code blocks
Load user-defined formatting preferences from project standards
Enforce professional appearance across code and documentation deliverables
Validate formatting consistency before final delivery
limitations: Provides formatting instructions for AI to follow, does not execute formatter tools directly
Requires StandardsRepository integration to access user formatting preferences
Works with AI-generated content in memory, does not modify files on disk

use_cases.title: Code Style Enforcement
use_cases.description: Apply team indentation rules, naming conventions, and spacing standards to AI-generated code before code review

use_cases.title: Documentation Consistency
use_cases.description: Standardize markdown headers, list formatting, and code block styles across generated documentation

use_cases.title: Deliverable Polish
use_cases.description: Ensure all AI-generated outputs meet organizational style guidelines before client or stakeholder delivery

prompt_templates.title: Basic Formatting
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply standard formatting to this deliverable. Check indentation, spacing, and naming consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Use Project Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the project standards from StandardsRepository and apply the formatting preferences. Use configured linter and formatter conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Formatting
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this documentation with consistent header hierarchy, list styles, code block formatting, and professional appearance throughout.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Standardization
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform complete standardization including code formatting, documentation style, naming conventions, spacing rules, and ensure production-ready consistency across all sections.

output_examples.input: Format this JavaScript code to match our team standards
output: Enforced single quote style for strings
Added semicolons consistently at statement ends
Formatted function parameters with proper spacing
Code is now ready for code review
Normalized header levels to proper hierarchy
Converted all lists to consistent bullet style
Formatted code blocks with language identifiers

best_practices: Define formatting standards in project configuration before starting development
Use the same formatting tools and conventions across your entire codebase
Apply this skill as the final step before code review or delivery
anti_patterns: Mixing spaces and tabs for indentation in the same file or project
Applying different formatting rules to different files in the same project
Skipping formatting validation when rushing to meet deadlines

faq.question: Does this skill execute formatting tools like Prettier or ESLint?
faq.answer: No. This skill guides AI output formatting. It provides instructions that the AI follows. Use actual CLI tools separately for file-based formatting.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my existing project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill works with AI-generated content during the generation process. It does not perform file system operations or modify existing files.

faq.question: How are my formatting preferences stored and loaded?
faq.answer: Preferences are loaded from StandardsRepository which reads project configuration files and commonPatterns settings from your workspace.

faq.question: What types of files can be formatted with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill applies to code (JavaScript, Python, TypeScript), documentation (Markdown, text), and general content creation output.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use with sensitive code?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, network access, or file system operations beyond reading its own documentation.

faq.question: How does this differ from using Prettier or ESLint directly?
faq.answer: This skill guides AI as it generates output. Prettier and ESLint are CLI tools that format existing files. Use both together for comprehensive formatting.
